HAT in Python

Submodules

HAT.graph module

class HAT.graph.graph(A)[source]

Bases: object

This class represents pairwise graph structures.

clusteringCoef(vx)[source]

Computes the clustering coefficient of a single vertex.

property degree

The degree matrix of a graph.

erdosRenyi(p)[source]

Constructs a $G_{n,p}$ Erdős-Rényi random graph. … .. rubric:: References

1

  1. Erdős and A. Rényi, On Random Graphs, Publ. Math. 6, 290 (1959).

2

    1. Gilbert, Random Graphs, Ann. Math. Stat., 30, 1141 (1959).

property laplacian

The Laplacian matrix of a graph.

pairwiseDistance(vxi, vxj)[source]

Computes the pairwise distance between vertices i and j.

HAT.hypergraph module

class HAT.hypergraph.hypergraph(w)[source]

Bases: object

This class represents multiway hypergraph structures.

adjacencyTensor()[source]

This constructs the adjacency tensor for uniform hypergraphs.

avgDistance()[source]

The average distance is computed between any vertices in the hypergraph based on the average distance of the clique expansion.

cliqueExpand()[source]

The clique expansion graph is constructed.

degreeTensor()[source]

This constructs the degree tensor for uniform hypergraphs.

dualGraph()[source]

The dual hypergraph is constructed.

laplacianTensor()[source]

This constructs the Laplacian tensor for uniform hypergraphs.

lineGraph()[source]

The line graph, which is the clique expansion of the dual graph is constructed.

starGraph()[source]

The star graph representation is constructed.

HAT.plot module

HAT.plot.IM(H)[source]

Plot the incidence matrix of a hypergraph. :param H: a hypergraph object
